summary: The document is a restricted military record concerning Manuel Marti, a person of interest in a DOD-affiliated personnel incident investigation. It outlines an education record and an interview conducted at Bronx Community College (BCC) to ascertain Marti's attendance during the summer session of 1967. The investigation revealed that the college's records were incomplete, missing crucial details such as instructors, courses, and major studies. An interview with Mrs. Mildred Kraft, the assistant registrar, corroborated the absence of comprehensive information on Marti's academic endeavors at BCC. This document, classified as restricted and later released with deletions, forms part of a broader inquiry into incidents involving DOD-affiliated personnel.
key_findings: Manuel Marti attended Bronx Community College during the summer session of 1967.
The college's records on Marti were incomplete, lacking details on courses, instructors, and previous education.
An interview with the assistant registrar, Mrs. Mildred Kraft, confirmed the lack of information on Marti's academic activities at BCC.
The document is part of a larger investigation into DOD-affiliated personnel incidents, classified as restricted and later released with deletions.
